cats.name: Luna
cats.Description: Luna was the unofficial leader of her community on 95th Street.Confident, daring and friendly are just a few ways to describe her. This purrfect cat can thrive anywhere. She will be the perfect solo pet in any home.

cats.name: Marley
cats.Description: This sweet boy was plucked from a driveway on 94th Street. His purrs are so loud! Marley is friendly with dogs and other cats. He is still learning to be a kitten and could really use your help!

cats.name: Pirate Jenny
cats.Description: Pirate Jenny was brought inside when she was just a few weeks old. She is a fiesty fighter but this little kitten is such a lover; she will give you kisses and licks! She might only have 1 eye but that doesn't stop her from lving her best cat life.

cats.name: Lily & Alfie
cats.Description: Lily and Alfie are too precious! This brother-sister duo play as hard as they love! Immediately friendly with humans, they also likes dogs, other cats and children. These two will keep you entertained all of the time!

cats.name: Whinnie
cats.Description: Whinnie is a confident street cat. She lived outside for many years before deciding she could use a little help from a kind human. Her ear is tipped as she was intended to be released but she warmed up to the inside life so quickly that she's here to stay!

cats.name: Mo
cats.Description: Baby Mo! Mo was caught along side his fiercely protective mothe and he couldn't be happier inside. He has CH, Cerebellar Hypoplasia, which is a syndrome that makes him a lttle wobbly when he walks. That doesn't stop him from playing. This sweet kitten doesn't love dogs but is good with other cats and children.

cats.name: Wink
cats.Description: Wink is a one eyed cat from 94th Street. Her partial vision has never stopped her from leading a full life. While not quite a kitten anymore, Wink is as playful and as curious as any precious baby. She loves to chase tiny toys and she loves to watch the snow fall!

cats.name: Marley
cats.Description: This adorable brother-sister pair were found on 92nd Street. Clyde is quite sweet, snuggly and affectionate. Big sister Bonnie has a feisty side and plays hard. These two just want to be loved! They are not good with dogs.
